meanings.definition: Treating complex issues or problems as if they were much simpler than they really are.
meanings.sent1: Her simplistic explanation of the scientific theory left out crucial details.
meanings.sent2: The article's simplistic approach failed to address the nuances of the political situation.
meanings.sent3: His simplistic view of relationships led to many misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The simplistic solution proposed by the committee overlooked important factors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's simplistic analogy made the concept easy to understand.

meanings.sent1: The simplistic design of the house lacked any intricate details.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were so simplistic that even a child could follow them.
meanings.sent3: The simplistic plot of the movie made it predictable but enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe consisted of simplistic outfits in neutral colors.
meanings.sent5: The artist's simplistic style resonated with many viewers for its purity.
